content: elegant and airy this crochet duster is perfect for layering over dresses or a tee shirt and jeans an all-over leaf lace pattern is made up of mostly double_crochet and chain stitches making it very intuitive to work sleeves feature simple shell lace patterns and are worked seamlessly from the armholes finished with a trellis-style fringe that adds a nice decorative touch and gives an opportunity to practice another popular craft macramé time 35-40 hrs skill level intermediate size 44 55 66 77 88 finished garment chest circumference with open front intended with 10-12 of positive ease gauge 20 double_crochet x 10 row = 4 x 4 in double_crochet worked flat each lace repeat is 5 5 wide x 11 long yarn anzula breeze lace 65% silk 35% linen 750 yards 685 meters /100g spruce 3 skeins hook 3 5 mm us size e notions tapestry needle tape measure scissors duster is worked bottom-up in one piece to underarm after separating for fronts and back each section worked separately to shoulders after seaming shoulder seams sleeves worked top-down in the round from armholes fringe applied with crochet hook and knotted to create trellis design
